Package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.asyncfs

Interface AsyncFSOutput

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
FanOutOneBlockAsyncDFSOutput, WrapperAsyncFSOutput
@Private public interface AsyncFSOutput extends Closeable
Interface for asynchronous filesystem output stream.

The implementation is not required to be thread safe.

  • Method Details

    • write

      void write(byte[] b)
      Just call write(b, 0, b.length).
      See Also:
      • write(byte[], int, int)

    • write

      void write(byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Copy the data into the buffer. Note that you need to call flush(boolean) to flush the buffer manually.

    • writeInt

      void writeInt(int i)
      Write an int to the buffer.

      void write(ByteBuffer bb)
      Copy the data in the given bb into the buffer.

      Return the current size of buffered data.

    • isBroken

      boolean isBroken()
      Whether the stream is broken.

    • getPipeline

      org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.DatanodeInfo[] getPipeline()
      Return current pipeline. Empty array if no pipeline.

    • flush

      CompletableFuture<Long> flush(boolean sync)
      Flush the buffer out.
      Parameters:
      sync - persistent the data to device
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that hold the acked length after flushing.

    • recoverAndClose

      void recoverAndClose(CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException
      The close method when error occurred.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      void close() throws IOException
      Close the file. You should call recoverAndClose(CancelableProgressable) if this method throws an exception.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Throws:
      IOException

      Returns byteSize success synced to underlying filesystem.
